newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft says Latam sales growing 50 pct per year.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft says Latam sales growing 50 pct per year.

text.p: Microsoft Corp's Latin America chief said Tuesday that total sales in the region would be about $500 million this year and that they were growing at a compound rate of 50 percent a year.

"The growth we have had consistently for the last three years has been 50 percent compound a year...on average," Microsoft regional director for Latin America Mauricio Santillan told Reuters in an interview. "Sales...have to be close to $500 million for this year."

Santillan said he saw those growth rates continuing at least for the next two or three years. Margins in Latin America were exactly the same as in the rest of the company, he added, but gave no details.
Earlier Microsoft chairman and chief executive officer Bill Gates told a news conference that he saw "very high growth" for the company in the Far East and Latin America.

"I'd say that the Far East and Latin America are the two very high growth areas for Microsoft, and I'm not sure which one will be higher growth," Gates said during a Microsoft conference in Miami with Latin American business leaders.
Santillan said market share for its Office software was about 90 percent in the region while its Explorer Internet browser had achieved market share of about 60 percent.
